channel.title: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot
channel.description:
yea, since every other idea of mine was a failure, im working on something that to my knowledge has not yet been done, an rs bot that reads bytecodes to figure out what to do. Unfortunately, whilst i do have experience with bytecode editing, i dont have an understanding of the way the java vm works. Things like memory allocation remain illusive to me, where as in a normal c program its well understood. After this is figured out, we could start hooking some of the apis (are they called apis in java?) if we needed, but i dont think that will happen any time soon. I think if a project like this is to proceed, we will need atleast three people who have experience with bytecode editing and programming.
No, "i can use artmonkey and have made a few scar scripts" does not count, what i am talking about is incredibly complicated.
Is there anyone out there that would be willing to work on such a project?

item.title: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot
item.dc:creator: @Asm Asm
item.description:
@Asm wrote:

I’m currently working on such project (bytecode analyzing and modifying on-the-fly)
Now making library capable of disassembling, modifying and reassembling .class files…

Read full topic

item.title: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

the hello world program is kinda generic. i mean, if you wanna make a scar script to say hello world, how many ways are there to do it. also spacing is kinda generic too. if you really want proof, give me something simple (aka less than 10 mins to make) and ill give it to you.

Read full topic
item.source: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot

item.title: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot
item.dc:creator: @Your_Grandpa Your Grandpa
item.description:
@Your_Grandpa wrote:

[quote=“DEAD, post:6, topic:7330”]theres enough documentation to figure the java vm out.

btw, what sorta experience in asm do you want, will this do

[code]
dosseg
.model small
.stack 100h

.data
hello db ‘Hello, World!’,0dh,0ah,’$’

.code
main proc
mov ax,@data
mov ds,ax

  mov    ah,9
  mov    dx,offset hello
  int    21h

  mov    ax,4C00h
  int    21h

main endp
end main
[\code]

good enough, lol i know, its only hello world, but i know more than that believe me.[/code][/quote]You could just have given the link:
http://www2.latech.edu/~acm/helloworld/asm.html

Read full topic
item.source: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot

item.title: Would anyone be interested in assembling a team to make a memory reading bot
item.dc:creator: @Tilex Tilex
item.description:
@Tilex wrote:

Uhhhh, the concept has been attempted before (to my knowledge), but if you want help, I’d be willing. Show me that you have some decent backing to this project first.
My experience:
C++
ASM
Java
C
BASIC/VB
PASCAL

Read full topic
